metadata.description:
Exploring moving structures with changing behaviors.

Made with thi.ng.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: EDDY #27
metadata.description:
An eddy is a circular movement of water counter to a main current. It reminds me of innovations in art, like a small countercurrent to the mainstream, surfacing new techniques and aesthetics. 

I hope that EDDY will brighten your days with its playful swirl of colors, inspired by the sea, the sky, the birds, and post-impressionist paintings.

Keyboard Controls:
[F] Fill the window.
[S] Save the current view in live mode as an image (default 1125x1500px).
[1] [2] [4] [6] Change resolution, 1.5K to 9K.
[R] Reverse course.

Made with p5js and shaders.

Created by elsif, 2022.12.

metadata.name: CHIP #76
metadata.description:
A CHIP is being constructed by using two brushes that are painting on the board through deterministic noise, and then turned squared and pixelated and blended into each other, with colours selected from 21 different colour schemes. How many iterations, and the speed and size of the added parts determines the final composition. 

You can stop the iterations by pressing S, and download the current composition by hitting D, and restart/reload the iterations by pressing R.

Notes
The thumbnail generation takes a while and the render/iterations in non-GPU browser can be quite slow. Chrome/Firefox recommended.

metadata.name: Be Creative #49
metadata.description:
What do you see?    a duck? a face? maybe a duck-face? faceduck?

follow these steps:
1. draw with the mouse on top of the generated paint
(draw that faceduck you love so much)
2. right-click-save the image
3. feel free to share, make it your pfp, mint it or whatever, but please tag me (Loosh) or #becreative

have fun and be creative

metadata.name: KoP.003 Studies Series #94
metadata.description:
Kingdom of Peripatetica (KoP.003 Studies Series) explores the creation of a world constructed of segmented, soft-body primitives. In this piece, open and closed frames float in a mirrored room controlled by hidden forces, including: gravity, wind, turbulence and rigid spheres.

Interaction:

Mouse/Trackpad:
drag -> camera rotation
Mouse Rt Btn -> camera pan
scroll wheel/pinch -> camera zoom

Key Input:
f, g: - | + gravity
e, w: east-west wind 
n, s: north-south wind
<, >: reduce | increase turbulence
-, +: remove | add sphere
r: reset dynamics


Note:
Please post your favorite KoP.003 screen captures
TW: @iragreenberg
IG: @greenberg.ira

Built with three.js, PByte.js, TypeScript, Node

metadata.name: Diaphanous Sprouts  #7

metadata.description:
Imagine Rorschach is a Rorschach-inspired study. 
Each mint will be different and each brain will imagine different.

This work was created using p5.js and love :)

metadata.name: Glass, Ruler, Pen #164
metadata.description:
Memories of childhood, so simple, all you need is paper,
Glass, Ruler, Pen.

metadata.name: Shapes of the civilization #4
metadata.description:
In my first generative work, I put together two things about myself: my past and my present/future.
I combine my past as a construction worker, with more than a decade of experience, with my current present of 5 years, as a multimedia artist.

It took me a long time to build this project, there were countless restarts until I finally found the path I wanted to follow.
As a multimedia artist I always like to learn new techniques, and when I discovered fxhash I had no doubts, I wanted to learn creative coding, and this is the result of my work and dedication.

I used elements of architecture mixed with my greatest passion (and also where I spent most of my time until I delve into programming), oil painting!
The color palettes were inspired by some painters I admire, making this work even more special and personal.

In live mode: Press 's' to save as PNG (4800x4800)

Made with p5js and love.
May-June 2022

NFT License 2.0

metadata.name: 3ASF #81
metadata.description:
3 Armonografos Sobre Figuras / 3 Harmonographs on Shapes

"If I had to choose, the harmonograph is my preferred mechanism for making gen art"

The composition works with three harmonographs vertically distributed with 2 pendulums each that draw on black and white shapes. It is a game between the positive and the negative.

Steps-Layers:

1 - White or black background
2 - Draw shape 1 (triangle or Circle or Rectangle) with the opposite tone to the background.
3 - Draw shape 2 (triangle or Circle or Rectangle) same tone as the background.
4 - Draw the 3 Harmonographs. The (inverted) tones depend on the tones of the shapes and background.
5 - Cutting / glitch effect. Vertical and horizontal.
6 - Symmetries X or Y or XY or none are applied.
7 - Rectangles are cut again (yes/no)

// ---

"Si tuviese que elegir, el armonografo es mi mecanismo preferido para hacer arte generativo"

La composición trabaja con tres armónografos de 2 péndulos distribuídos verticalmente que dibujan sobre figuras en blanco y negro. Es un juego entre positivos y negativos.

Pasos-Capas: 

1 - Fondo blanco o negro
2 - Dibuja figura 1 (triangulo o Circulo o Rectangulo) con tono opuesto al fondo.
3 - Dibuja figura 2 (triangulo o Circulo o Rectangulo) mismo tono que el fondo.
4 - Dibuja los 3 Armonógrafos. Los tonos (invertidos) dependen de los tonos de la figura y el fondo.
5 - Se corta / efecto glitch. Vertical y horizontal.
6 - Se aplican simetrias X o Y o XY o ninguna.
7 - Se cortan nuevamente rectángulos (si/no)

// ---
Keys:

[1,2,3] -> change pixel density. Or can be passed via url ?pd=5 6000x9000pix. Be aware for the file size in render. 
[s] -> download canvas capture. Different pixel density, different sizes.
[double tap] -> download canvas capture on mobile

metadata.name: YANF #51
metadata.description:
Yet Another Noises and Flows

After three works on landscapes I returned to an abstract work in which I used several kinds of noise fields and a different approach to flow lines.

In this work I use three intermediate images to generate the final image:
- on the first image to each pixels is assigned a color related to the value of the noise field in that point using the main color palette
- on the second image the gradient orientation (angle) of the field is used to assign colors using a secondary palette with the purpose of giving lights and shadows to the final image
- on the third image flow lines are drawn using the direction perpendicular to the gradient, in this way the flows are aligned to the contour lines

After the second and third step the new generated image is blended with the previous giving rise to the final image.

Developed with p5.js

Default resolution: 2400x1600, 1600x2400, 2000x2000 (3/2, 2/3, 1/1 aspect ratio)

[2] to redraw at double resolution (it takes four times then default)
[1] to redraw at default resolution
[s] to save a png at current resolution

Sources of variations are:
- 14 palettes
- 6 kinds of combinations of noise type and fractal type
- 8 kinds of cuts
- 3 kinds of aspect ratio
- 3 border thickness

This Generative Token uses the FastNoiseLite.js and chroma.js libraries.

Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.
